text: Order to amend the Order [of 4th April, 1928 — Legislative Series, 2928 (Russ. lo, D)] respecting the conditions of employment in constructional work a — in par. I, delete the words "subject to his consent ", and add a new paragraph to read: "In default of work approximating to his grade, payment shall be made for the lost days at the scheduled rate if they do not last for more than one month. If the lost time does not exceed three days, payment shall be made at the average rate of earnings. ". 4 is amended to read: " When work is impossible owing to rain or other atmospheric conditions, the employer may set the employees to other work approximating to their grade. In this case the employees shall receive pay for the new work, but not less than the previous scheduled rate. In default of work approximating to their grade, payment shall be made for tile lost time at the scheduled rate. ". In 7, par. 3, delete the reference "(section 2)".]. (Coóp. 3arc. ch. 36)
full_text: Jan. 3 Order to amend the Order [of 4th April, 1928 — Legislative Series, 2928 (Russ. lo, D)] respecting the conditions of employment in constructional work a — in par. I, delete the words "subject to his consent ", and add a new paragraph to read: "In default of work approximating to his grade, payment shall be made for the lost days at the scheduled rate if they do not last for more than one month. If the lost time does not exceed three days, payment shall be made at the average rate of earnings. ". 4 is amended to read: " When work is impossible owing to rain or other atmospheric conditions, the employer may set the employees to other work approximating to their grade. In this case the employees shall receive pay for the new work, but not less than the previous scheduled rate. In default of work approximating to their grade, payment shall be made for tile lost time at the scheduled rate. ". In 7, par. 3, delete the reference "(section 2)".]. (Coóp. 3arc. ch. 36).

text: Order to amend the second paragraph of section 6 of the Order of 15th January, issuing general rules for the adoption of the maximum working day 6 par. 2, to read For overtime worked at night or on Sunday or beyond the first ten hours of any day, the increase shall not be less than 40 per cent.". This is to be held to mean that work may be done on Sunday under the Sunday Rest Act without any overtime pay so long as the limits of the eight-hour day and forty-eight hour week are not exceeded thereby]. (G.M. no. lot, p. 277; A.L.S. vol. 1, p. 574)

This is to be held to mean that work may be done on Sunday under the Sunday Rest Act without any overtime pay so long as the limits of the eight-hour day and forty-eight hour week are not exceeded thereby]. (G.M. no. lot, p. 277; A.L.S. vol. 1, p. 574)
